metadata.Title: CVE-2017-18208 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The madvise_willneed function in mm/madvise.c in the Linux kernel before 4.14.4 allows local users to cause a denial of service (infinite loop) by triggering use of MADVISE_WILLNEED for a DAX mapping. It was discovered that an infinite loop could occur in the madvise(2) implementation in the Linux kernel in certain circumstances. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system hang).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18208` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:
